comments.body:
This last sentence isn't clear. Does that mean they could even if it wasn't dynamic? Does it mean that matchers must be passed in?

We should have a longer paragraph that talks about what exactly can be passed in.

Ideally we wouldn't use dynamic. Maybe have `transform` and `transformMatches`, where the second takes a "Matcher"?
You don't seem to actually ever call the matcher API, so I'm not sure how this is working.

Added more doc following the `paragraph` call example that uses the dynamic pattern too. 

The matching is done via _FunctionPaintPredicate which checks each argument for equality or match. The deep matcher via `equals` compares the Float64List's iterable's value with more matchers.
I would probably break this line

i left this one... it's part of a bunch of more or less identical methods that just duplicate their arguments into constructor calls. It's probably easier to read if it's just skipped over as obviously mechanical code.
please update the paintsNothing documentation too (and maybe spot check a few existing call sites to make sure this is ok, in case you haven't done that already)
